message.content:
cs.FL, cs.LO, cs.DM, cs.IT, cs.CC

The paper deals with the correspondence between classes of regular languages and classes of algebraic structures, specifically finite (ordered) automata and semiautomata. This falls under the area of formal languages and automata theory, which is covered by cs.FL. The paper also introduces the concept of positive $\mathcal C$-varieties of ordered semiautomata, which involves the use of ordered structures, placing it under cs.LO. The paper also involves some algebraic concepts, such as monoids and pseudovarieties, which are covered by cs.DM and cs.IT. Finally, the paper deals with the correspondence between classes of languages and classes of automata, which falls under cs.CC.
